Triggering Event: He found her old scarf in his desk drawer, the one she'd left behind after their last fight. It seemed pointless holding onto something that only brought up painful feelings. She wasn't going to come back for it anyway.

Triggering Event: In the quiet of his study, he opened an old drawer, revealing a faded photograph of him and his ex-wife, laughing together at some long-forgotten moment. The clock on the wall ticked on, each second echoing like an accusation in his quiet, empty house.

His life has been one endless cycle of disappointment, and it’s pointless to hold onto anything that might bring him happiness - for it will ultimately lead to further suffering.
